data.title: Foundation for California Community Colleges

data.text:
Integrating advanced facility management tools.

FoundationCCC has been providing facilities and building data services to the 116 campus system since 2002, including building assessments, Facilities Utilization, Space Inventory Options Net (FUSION), and California Community College Geographic Information Systems (CCC GIS).

FUSION and the CCC GIS operated separately until March 2011, when the ONUMA System brought the two databases together to become the largest cloud computing building information modeling (BIM) and GIS platform. The new integrated FUSION + CCC GIS + ONUMA system expands the capabilities of the colleges to manage and plan their physical space more effectively and efficiently.

Mapping the California Community Colleges.

CCC GIS provides a common repository for the various maps, documents, links, and other tools we are collecting in our ongoing work. The maps produced over time will help to answer questions important to the mission of the California Community Colleges, including questions about regional demographics and population growth, election histories and bond election planning, enrollment forecasting, enrollment patterns of neighboring districts, workforce development, facilities planning and maintenance, and more.

CCC GIS Map

Access an interactive map of all 72 physical districts and 115 physical campuses that make up the California Community College system.
